text:
(1)
Richmond Avenue, west side, between Richmond Hill Road and Meadow Lane, showing the Barne-Tysen House. It was built in 1680 by the family that came from Holland in 1660 and received a land grant in 1677.

P. L. Sperr

(2)
The same, another view.

March 25, 1927

P. L. Sperr
title: Richmond: [Staten Island] - Richmond Avenue (East) - Richmond Hill Road - Meadow Lane.

title: Richmond: [Staten Island] - Richmond Avenue (East) - Richmond Hill Road - Meadow Lane.

original_title: Richmond: Richmond Avenue - Richmond Hill Road
text:
Richmond Avenue, east side, about 300 yards north of Richmond Hill Road. This house was owned by M. Simonson in 1874; by Reuben Miller from 1898 to 1907, and by William Eith in 1917.

May 6, 1929

P. L. Sperr

original_title: Richmond: Richmond Avenue - Richmond Hill Road
text:
(1)
Richmond Avenue, east side, about 250 feet north of Richmond Hill Road. The house and farmland were owned by O. N. Melvin from 1898 to 1907; later by W. Haughwout. The view is from Richmond Hill Road.

May 6, 1929

P. L. Sperr

(2)
Another view of the house as seen from Richmond Avenue. It is at this date,(1937) the Staten Island Plant Nursery.

May 18, 1937

P. L. Sperr

original_title: Richmond: Richmond Avenue - Richmond Hill Road
text:
(1)
Richmond Avenue, east side, about 250 feet north of Richmond Hill Road. The house and farmland were owned by O. N. Melvin from 1898 to 1907; later by W. Haughwout. The view is from Richmond Hill Road.

May 6, 1929

P. L. Sperr

(2)
Another view of the house as seen from Richmond Avenue. It is at this date,(1937) the Staten Island Plant Nursery.

May 18, 1937

P. L. Sperr

Richmond Avenue, east side, about 200 yards north of Richmond Hill Road. This house was owned by Foster from 1874 to 1898 and by J. F. Zimmer from 1907 to 1917.

May 6, 1929

P. L. Sperr
title: Richmond: [Staten Island] - Richmond Avenue (East) - Richmond Hill Road.

original_title: Richmond: Richmond Avenue - Richmond Hill Road
text:
Richmond Avenue, north from Richmond Hill Road.

May 10, 1937

P. L. Sperr

Richmond Avenue, west side, between Richmond Hill Road and Meadow Lane, showing the Barne-Tysen House. It was built in 1680 by the family that came from Holland in 1660 and received a land grant in 1677.

September 20, 1937
Views 1, 2, 3

P. L. Sperr
